Exams (details in syllabus)

title: Syllabus
text: This course introduces probability models and statistical methods, including discrete and continuous random variables, estimation, hypothesis testing, and simple regression.

title: Syllabus
text: This course introduces probability models and statistical methods, including discrete and continuous random variables, estimation, hypothesis testing, and simple regression.

title: Syllabus
text:
Learning Objectives

Understand basic probability concepts.
Work with discrete and continuous distributions.
Use sampling distributions to construct estimators and tests.
Interpret confidence intervals and p-values in context.

title: Resources
text: Wackerly, Mendenhall, and Scheaffer, Mathematical Statistics with Applications.

title: MATH 476 — Statistics
text:
Welcome to MATH 476 — Statistics.
This course introduces probability and statistics with an emphasis on modeling, data, and careful reasoning.
